item.title: Report E-2024080719
item.description:
Report E-2024080719

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-24T09:21:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-26
  • City: NORTH CHARLESTON
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 08/26/2024, at 0820 hours, personnel in the CSXT Bennett Yard discovered GATX 6644, a loaded tank car of Sulfuric Acid, leaking from the top of the tank car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Southern States Chemical Inc, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2024-08-26-00040. HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found that the retainer cap, rupture disk and surge protector were missing from the safety vent of the tank car. Contractor personnel installed a surge protector, rupture disk and disc retainer, as well as decontaminated the top and sides of the rail car. The issue was identified, and corrective actions, were communicated to the shipperâ€™s representative (Clay Hester, 912-944-7107). Emergency response efforts secured the car from leaking; it was held at location pending additional work by a certified tank car repair facility that could performed a qualified repaired.
